ApiRole.description: Stax role assigned to an API Token.

AwsAccessRole.description: AWS access roles enabled for an account type.

SupportPlan.description: Stax Support Plan allocated to the Customer.

Users.description: Array of IDs of Users belonging to the Group.

Alias.description: Alias for your Organisation. This alias will be used in the URL of your Stax Identity Broker.

AllowedDomains.description: Allowed email domains for the Organisation, this limits who can be invited to your Team.

AwsAccountEmailTemplate.description: AWS Accounts will be registered with email addresses fitting this pattern. Please ensure these email addresses are secured, as they can be used for Root Credential recovery.

AwsPartnerSupport.description: AWS Partner Led Support - if you have partner led support then Stax Support will open AWS Support cases on your behalf.

AwsSupportType.description: Default AWS Support level set on Accounts in your Organisation.

AttachableTo.description: Whether a policy is org only or account type only, or both

Description.example: A service control policy that denies access to all.

Mandatory.description: Boolean value declaring if the policy is mandatory or not.

Public.description: Boolean value declaring if the policy is public or private.

PhoneNumber.description: Phone number of User in E.164 format.

Region.description: AWS Region the workload will be launched in

Description.example: A Workload to build a VPC in my org

info.description: The Stax API is organised around REST, uses resource-oriented URLs, return responses are JSON and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication and verbs.
info.title: Stax Core API

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is forbidden.

404.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

put.description: Add Policies to Account types or Remove Policies from Account Types.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

get.description:
Return all AWS Accounts within your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested AWS Account.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Account to return.
parameters.name: account_id

parameters.description:
The Account statuses to return, comma delimited.

Filter options available: NOAWS, NEW, INITIALIZING, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, MAINTENANCE, AWSERROR.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: List of Account IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

parameters.description: Pagination - The page number to return.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Pagination - The number of items per page to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The field to sort on.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: The sort order - up or down?
parameters.name: sort_order

parameters.description: Do you want all the Tags?
parameters.name: include_tags

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description: Create a new Stax-hardened AWS Account in your Stax Organisation.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

get.description:
Return all the Account Types in your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested Account Type.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Account Type.
parameters.name: account_type_id

parameters.description: List of AccountType IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description:
Create a new Account Type within your Stax Organisation.
Account Types can be used to set Policies on Accounts and control Group access.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is forbidden.

put.description: Adjust the AWS role permissions between Account Types and Groups.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

delete.description:
Delete an Account Type from your Stax Organisation.
An Account Type can only be deleted if there are no attached Accounts.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Catalogue item.
parameters.name: account_type_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is forbidden.

get.description:
Return all the Account Types in your Stax Organisation.

get.description: Return a list of all API Tokens within your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Token to return.
parameters.name: AccessKey

parameters.description: List of Access Keys you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

parameters.description:
List of Workload statuses you want returned, comma delimited.

Filter Options available: ACTIVE, DELETED
parameters.name: status

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description: Create an API Token for API/SDK access within your Stax Organisation.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

delete.description: Delete an API Token from your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the User to delete.
parameters.name: AccessKey

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

get.description: Return a list of all API Tokens within your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Token to return.
parameters.name: AccessKey

List of Workload statuses you want returned, comma delimited.

get.description:
Return all Groups within your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested Group.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Group to return.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: List of Group IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description: Create a new Group within your Stax Organisation.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

put.description: Add members to a Group or Remove members from a Group

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: Could not locate user or group.

delete.description:
Delete a Group from your Stax Organisation.
A Group can only be deleted if there are no team members in the Group.

parameters.description: The UUID of Group to delete.
parameters.name: group_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The Group still contains members.

404.description: The Group could not be found.

get.description:
Return all Groups within your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested Group.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Group to return.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: List of Group IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

put.description: Change the details of a Group, such as the name.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Group to update.
parameters.name: group_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

get.description: Return a list of all IDAM Users in your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The Organisation ID in which the IDAM is deployed to.  If no org_id is supplied, the Customer's default Organisation will be used.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: Do you want all the Tags?
parameters.name: include_tags

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description:
Create a new Stax user within your Stax Organisation.
Stax Users have permission to access the AWS Console/CLI for AWS Accounts that exist within a Stax Organisation.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

put.description: Re-send the verification email for a Stax User.

parameters.description: The UUID of the IDAM User to re-invite.
parameters.name: user_id_to_update

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if the user has already verified their email address.

403.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

404.description: The response returned if the user does not exist in IDAM.

put.description: Send a Stax User a password reset email.

parameters.description: The UUID of the IDAM User to have password reset.
parameters.name: user_id_to_update

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

get.description: Return a list of all IDAM Users in your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The Organisation ID in which the IDAM is deployed to.  If no org_id is supplied, the Customer's default Organisation will be used.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.description: Do you want all the Tags?
parameters.name: include_tags

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

put.description: Update a Stax User's details, such as the name, role or email.

parameters.description: The UUID of the IDAM User to update.
parameters.name: user_id_to_update

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

get.description:
Return a list of your Stax Organisations.
A Stax Organisation is an instance of Stax which houses your AWS Accounts, Workloads and IDAM Users.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful. The response body contains an Organisation array.

get.description:
Return the current users Organisation.
A Stax Organisation is an instance of Stax which houses your AWS Accounts, Workloads and IDAM Users.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful. The response body contains an Organisation array.

get.description:
Return all Policies in your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested Policy.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to return.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

post.description: Create a Policy in your Stax Organisation.

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

delete.description:
Detach a Policy from your Stax Organisation.
The policy will no longer apply to all Account Types within the Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to detach.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

put.description:
Attach a Policy to your Stax Organisation.
The policy will apply to all Account Types within the Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to attach.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

403.description: Unable to attach foundation policy to an Organisation.

delete.description: Delete a Policy from your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to delete.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

get.description:
Return all Policies in your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested Policy.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to return.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

put.description: Update an existing Policy within your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Policy to update.
parameters.name: policy_id

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

get.description:
Check if an Alias is available or if it is already in use by another Stax customer.
The Alias is the unique identifier for a Customer's Stax Organisation.

parameters.description:
A unique string containing characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9.
Hyphens can also be used, but not at the start or end of the alias.
parameters.name: alias

200.description: The response returned if the Alias is available and not in use by another Customer.

409.description: The Alias is already in use by another Customer.

get.description: This is an unauthenticated endpoint returning your configuration variables which are required to authenticate API requests.

200.description: Configuration values required to authenicate API requests.

get.description:
Return the status of the requested Task.
A Task may relate to an Account, User, Workload, Organisation or Log Event.

parameters.description: The UUID of the Task to return.
parameters.name: task_id

200.description: The response returned for a valid Task.

404.description: The response returned if the requested Task could not be found.

get.description:
Return all Tasks for your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return all tasks with the specified status for your Stax Organisation.
A Task may relate to an Account, User, Workload, Organisation or Log Event.

parameters.description:
Return all tasks of this status.

Accepted values are: RUNNING, SUCCEEDED or FAILED.
parameters.name: task_status

200.description: The Tasks returned for a valid task_status.

400.description: The task_status not supplied or invalid.

get.description:
Return all Tasks for your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return all tasks with the specified status for your Stax Organisation.
A Task may relate to an Account, User, Workload, Organisation or Log Event.

parameters.description:
Return all tasks of this status.

Accepted values are: RUNNING, SUCCEEDED or FAILED.
parameters.name: task_status

200.description: The Tasks returned for a valid task_status.

400.description: The task_status not supplied or invalid.

get.description:
Return a list of all Users within your Stax Organisation.
Optionally, return the requested User.

parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description:
List of Users filtered by auth origin, comma delimited.

Filter Options available: Team, Federated, Root
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: List of User IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

get.description:
Return all Workload Catalogue Items within your Stax Organisation.

parameters.description: The Name of the Workload Catalogue Items to return.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description:
List of Workload Catalogue Item statuses you want returned, comma delimited.

Filter options available: STARTED, RUNNING, SUCCEEDED, FAILED, TIMED_OUT, ABORTED.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: List of Workload Catalogue Item IDs you want returned, comma delimited.
parameters.name: id_filter

parameters.description: Pagination - The page number to return.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Pagination - The number of items per page to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The field to sort on.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: The sort order - up or down.
parameters.name: sort_order

parameters.description: Do you want all Versions?
parameters.name: include_versions

parameters.description: Do you want the Parameter dictionary?
parameters.name: include_parameters

parameters.description: Do you want all the Tags?
parameters.name: include_tags

200.description: The response returned if the request is successful.

400.description: The response returned if an invalid ID is entered.

403.description: The response returned if the request is not successful.

403.description: The response returned if the request is unsuccessful.

400.description: The response returned if an invalid ID is entered.

Creates a new version of a Workload Catalogue Item.
Workload Catalogue Items have one or more versions and are immutable, so any changes are a new version.

get.description:

parameters.description:
